My roommate moved out so there is a room now available in my house. : )

=A0=A0=A0=A0 The house is located in Marin in San Rafael in a safe, quiet se=
t back=20
neighborhood but only minutes away from downtown (which hosts a major transi=
t=20
center), 101 and 580. It is 20 mins to Berkeley, 15 to the Golden Gate, and=20
35-45 to Santa Rosa.
=A0=A0=A0=A0 The house has a large semi-landscaped backyard, fireplace, dish=
washer=20
and washer. There is a laundry mat all of five houses down if you need to us=
e=20
a dryer. The laundry mat is also across the street from a quaint market with=
=20
nearly everything you need, there is a racquet club just up the hill if you=20
like to swim or play tennis, plenty of parking in addition to the four space=
s=20
for the house and many hiking trails surrounding the area. The house is also=
=20
usually filled with fresh flowers and plants that I receive from work (an=20
added bonus at no extra charge ; ) ).
=A0=A0=A0=A0 You get the largest room with your own phone line already=20
installed/hooked up. There is also a cable line installed ready to be hooked=
=20
up. The dimensions of the room are 11'x12.5' with a closet and two windows.=20
Rent is 650 which *includes* utilities. It should be noted though, that it i=
s=20
a vegetarian kitchen. You can keep meat in the house, I would just prefer yo=
u=20
didn't cook it (though microwave stuff is okay). If you *really* need to coo=
k=20
it I just ask that you use your own pots/pans and clean thoroughly. You=20
should also know that I have a cat (short-haired). He is *very* sweet and=20
social and welcome to another kitty buddy if you have one. : D

And a bit about me- I'm an eighteen year old college student studying to be=20=
a=20
pyschoneuroimmunologist at the local college. I've been partying for four=20
years and I still go out regularly because I *love* to dance (why else would=
=20
I be on this list? ; ) ) and I'm a very social person. I'm a big house whore=
,=20
but I my taste in music is very eclectic ranging from Bjork, Tori Amos,=20
Porishead, De La Soul, Black Eyed Peas, Blackalicious, Badly Drawn Boy, Cibo=
=20
Matto, Billie Holiday, Chet Baker and yes, even Ace of Base. I've been raise=
d=20
Buddhist with a Shamanistic influence by my family to whom I am very close=20
with. I love to sing, read, clean and eat chocolate. Now that I'm writing=20
this I'm realizing it's very hard to summarize yourself...=A0 : D

The room is available immediately so if you are interested, know anyone who=20
is or just have some questions e-mail me back.

heart,
Alida

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Fw: : Lyceaum shut down by DEA?


doesn't Erowid have an ancilliary relationship with us good folks here @
hypperreal.org, like aren't we all on the same bank of servers?

back in my my salad, Yippie! days on Bleecker Street, around the time
Abbie/Barry came out from the cold, somebody blew up an M-80 firecracker in
front of our HQ @ #9,  just as some beat cops were passing by, prompting the
local media to report it as a bomb going off.

When the report hit the radio, one of my comrades, on hearing the report
exulted:

'we're on the wire, we've gone *national!*'

Next thing I knew I got to shake hands with William Kuntsler @ an impromptu
press conference we threw to deal with it.

this cbs report puts me in mind of that incident, tempest in the ol' teapot.

kind of specious for Dan Rather to end the report with the line 'flirting
with death,' since as a young man he served in the Marines, bet he had a
encyclopedia of knowledge available to him @ the time to let him know what
he was getting into.

not that it would have helped.

thanks, Andy.

nic

From sfraves-return-98232-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Tue Jan 28 10:48:36 2003

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Theatre, relevant or not?(long)


Alida asks:

I'm doing a survey for a class and wanted to know:

With the advent of other forms of entertainment such as film, video and
reality TV, is live theatre relevant?

Why or why not?

*To add a little perspective:

-number of people that go to the theatre per year- 120 million

-number of people that go see top ten movies every year- 350 million +
another billion

xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

and thank goodness for Jennifer's impassioned below response, nice to know
someone still feels that way, in this hyped up, super accelerated day and
age, and having met her at the SFR 10 yr party I have no doubt she's got a
decade or two of playing the ingenue in front of her.

; )

I'm adams, nic adams, i'm 38 and 7/8's, and i am a speaker, writer,
producer, independent contractor, i start revolutions, fit bras, empty bars,
tame tigers, fight wars, quell uprisings, organize orgies, run governments,
and as far as bongos, nails, whiskey, racing forms, fly swatters, nails,
land, and manure go, i can get 'em all for ya wholesale.

i've been busy, but wanted to get back to this post, but it's mad late, so i
won't give this a full blown answer, or mebbe i will because it's an
inneresting question....

i'm a lil knocked out that things have gotten so far that a friend of
Jennifer's would get confused about a character she plays on the stage,
welcome to our modern world i guess.

I grew up in NYC and Broadway, the Great White Way is in my blood, used to
pedal down it every nite on my way home.....

Everybody wants to get into the Broadway act, this song,
http://tinyurl.com/4zla especially the Neil Young version, has always
expressed that for me.

In a nutshell, to put it into perspective, along the lines you posted up
above, for your survey, Alida, consider this, please:

This week, alone, more people will sit through the current crop of reality
shows than all people who have sat through *all* live performances of *all*
Shakespeare's plays, in *all* theatres in the world that they've ever been
put in, since we humans have started producing them....

**COMBINED**

Thing is, Shakespeare was planted in the ground, his bones not to be
disturbed, a good 500 years ago or so.

"shall i compare thee to a midsummer's day....?'

500 years from now, if we're still around, is anyone going to remember any
David E. Kelley shows, like Allie McBeal, which undoubtably more people have
seen during its run than all Shakespeare's plays, combined, or who Joe
Milionaire picked and what her reaction was when she learned the *awful*
truth?

They might sit still for 'I Love Lucy' reruns though.

(tangental as hell: Ironic, inn't? Kind of like Kurt Cobain being named
artist of the decade by Rolling Stone, though he had been dead for most of
it...)

is live theatre relevant to our lives?

umm yeah....

robert pirsig covers some of this territory in his discussion of Chataqua's
from his book,

'Zen and the Art Of Motorcycle Maintenance,'
http://tinyurl.com/1ngu

and though he was kind of talking about something else some of the below is
germane in response to question of modern day relevance of live theatre,
since the Chataqua he speaks of is a form of live theatre:

"What is in mind is a sort of Chautauqua...that's the only name I can think
of for it...like the traveling tent-show Chautauquas that used to move
across America, this America, the one that we are now in, an old-time series
of popular talks intended to edify and entertain, improve the mind and bring
culture and enlightenment to the ears and thoughts of the hearer.

The Chautauquas were pushed aside by faster-paced radio, movies and TV, and
it seems to me the change was not entirely an improvement.

Perhaps because of these changes the stream of national consciousness moves
faster now, and is broader, but it seems to run less deep.

The old channels cannot contain it and in its search for new ones there
seems to be growing havoc and destruction along its banks.

In this Chautauqua I would like not to cut any new channels of consciousness
but simply dig deeper into old ones that have become silted in with the
debris of thoughts grown stale and platitudes too often repeated.

"What's new?"

is an interesting and broadening eternal question, but one which, if pursued
exclusively, results only in an endless parade of trivia and fashion, the
silt of tomorrow.

I would like, instead, to be concerned with the question

"What is best?,"

a question which cuts deeply rather than broadly, a question whose answers
tend to move the silt downstream. There are eras of human history in which
the channels of thought have been too deeply cut and no change was possible,
and nothing new ever happened, and "best" was a matter of dogma, but that is
not the situation now.

Now the stream of our common consciousness seems to be obliterating its own
banks, losing its central direction and purpose, flooding the lowlands,
disconnecting and isolating the highlands and to no particular purpose other
than the wasteful fulfillment of its own internal momentum.

Some channel deepening seems called for."


Seems to me that some of this 'channel deepening' he talks about is more
likely to come from live performance of art than video presentation of it,
so yeah, it's hella relevant, cuz if anything, don't you have a sense that
this lack of depth is something our culture is currently yearning for?

Or maybe it's just me, and what do i know, i still haven't outgrown my MTV.

k, i could go on, and on and on and on, and i prolly will, but you're on a
deadline for that survey of yours, but I got me some the original 39
'Honeymooner' episodes lined up right now, and oddly enough, in the half
century they've been around they're one of the few shows that have
maintained their relevance over time.

how many others can you name from today's current crop of shows that are
going to be around 50 years hence?

good luck, bet it's a mighty short list.

nic

who'd have *no problem* going mano a mano with
Virginia Woolf, c'mon and bring 'er on.


----- Original Message -----
From: "Jennifer Herron" <whtrabt@ix.netcom.com>
To: <LittleEtoile@aol.com>; <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Thursday, January 23, 2003 2:44 AM
Subject: RE: [sfraves] NRR: Theatre, relevant or not?(long)


***I am posting this to SFR because dammit this is something I feel
incredibly passionate about, more than most anything in my life. Whereas
raving has saved many of us on the list, theatre saved mine.***

Oh my goodness I could write a book on this subject...

I have been involved with live theatre for over 10 years now...god that
seems long! I have three associates degrees in technical theatre, acting and
direction but decided to forgo Theatre as a bachelors degree because what
director gives a crap if you have a degree. They want to know if you can DO.
I have been a techie building sets, hanging lights, running the board, and I
have been involved in 30 something (my bf counted I have not) productions
from Shakespeare, musical theatre, comedy, modern drama to vaudeville etc.

Anyway I feel that live theatre has huge relevance. I know this not only
from my standpoint, but from the view of some friends of mine who had never
been to a live performance until they had attended one of my shows.

Movies and tv may have all of the effects and glamour but there is nothing
like live theatre to suck you in. Having real, live breathing people in
front of you living the lives of wonderful characters can really give you a
charge. It's the ultimate in voyeurism. Real emotions can be seen and felt
(especially in some of the SRO, standing room only theatres I've worked in).
Of course the actors and directors have to be doing their job...sucky shows
can't do that for me though regardless of a show bombing or not I still have
that longing to be up there.

I think a lot of people don't go to theatre because they don't know about
it, or have never gone. Such was the case of several of my friends. It might
seem to be something uptight and they think they have to act a certain way
to see a show. Like it's a gala affair where you have to dress up. Sometimes
the show and what it makes them feel is threatening. TV can make you brain
dead but having three hours of Who's Afraid of Virginia Wolfe being thrown
into your face and brain is anything but. One theatre newbie friend could
hardly talk to me after that show. He kept asking questions of me as if I
was the character, like he had trouble differentiating us. That show really
screwed with his head (as it did with the actors every night) as it should
have.

I would encourage anyone to see at least one show in their life. Community
theatre is where it's happening in my opinion where you can see normal every
day folks working very hard on their craft because they love it not because
they get a paycheck. These shows are usually pretty cheap to, cheaper than a
movie and popcorn now-a-days. It may just change your life.

Rant off :)

Any more questions Alida?

Jennifer Herron
Age 30 (but still hanging on to those ingenue roles :D)
Preschool Teacher
http://www.angelfire.com/ca/chrysallys/actor.html

Hello everyone! I haven't posted in some time to the list, yet I have been
monitoring and emailing peeps privately. I hope that everyone is doing well
and would love to get involved in another SFR Dinner.

Anyways, for those who are interested, Thump Radio will be airing my live
NYE performance in celebration of my forthcoming album, The Tribal Realm, on
ALICE 97.3 at midnight, this Saturday. The show will feature one hour of my
original and some of my remix material. The album will feature ambient
reprises of my original tribal songs much and will sound much along the
lines of a Deep Forest or Enigma. The deadline for release is August 2003.

Forthcoming interviews, dj sets an the Tribal Realm performance will also be
airing Feb 7th on Channel 933 in San Diego and at 1am on Feb 27th on XM
Satellite Radio.

An interview and a show featuring my music are on show 24 which is airing
this month on the DISH network, entitled ANGEL ONE. I believe it is 242
shown in California 12:30AM or 30 minutes after midnights on Fridays.

What else has been going on? My music has also been licensed to appear on a
forthcoming pilot series on Fox, this summer, called "Keen Eddie". I am
currently working on other projects as well for Warner Bros. And Paramount.
 
I am also a member of a new band featuring Patrick Scott, Daniel Ash and
myself. Our debut single, a remake of the classic Blondie hit, Rapture has
just been completed and we begin work on our first album, next month.

Hope all is well! 8) MODA

Hello everyone! I haven't posted in some time to the list, yet I have been
monitoring and emailing peeps privately. I hope that everyone is doing well
and would love to get involved in another SFR Dinner.

Anyways, for those who are interested, Thump Radio will be airing my live
NYE performance in celebration of my forthcoming album, The Tribal Realm, on
ALICE 97.3 at midnight, this Saturday. The show will feature one hour of my
original and some of my remix material. The album will feature ambient
reprises of my original tribal songs much and will sound much along the
lines of a Deep Forest or Enigma. The deadline for release is August 2003.

Forthcoming interviews, dj sets an the Tribal Realm performance will also be
airing Feb 7th on Channel 933 in San Diego and at 1am on Feb 27th on XM
Satellite Radio.

An interview and a show featuring my music are on show 24 which is airing
this month on the DISH network, entitled ANGEL ONE. I believe it is 242
shown in California 12:30AM or 30 minutes after midnights on Fridays.

What else has been going on? My music has also been licensed to appear on a
forthcoming pilot series on Fox, this summer, called "Keen Eddie". I am
currently working on other projects as well for Warner Bros. And Paramount.

I am also a member of a new band featuring Patrick Scott, Daniel Ash and
myself. Our debut single, a remake of the classic Blondie hit, Rapture has
just been completed and we begin work on our first album, next month.

Hope all is well! 8) MODA



---------------------------------------------------------------------

for the addicted: i thought i was going to be able to go on-line in a time and place yesterday, but when that time and place arrived, there was not a computer, and i was not able to change the situation and look after myself, so, i skipped my post/column, writing piece, reply, and i was also kind of worried that maybe someone might be worried too, and then i was thinking about how maybe the worried one or ones wouldn't know that i was too cold and worrying and sort of getting sick and all of that, and then maybe they would and then would be worried or totally angry or something like that, and then i just told myself to FOCUS on the present, and well, here's my post...lots of good news going around these days...i won't bore anyone with detailed descriptions, but, well, i got some really cool girl products in pastels...i wasn't going to, but then i am sort of a collector of sorts, i suppose, and while i was talking myself into being more conservative about purchasing...i've been playing catch up, basically....but while i was talking myself into being conservative, i saw some REALLY, REALLY cute additions that fit REALLY, REALLY well, so i figured that the powers that be might let me get away with it. :)

for me to say "no I don't like it" :)

movie?

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  Go Kazaa!!!

--=====================_6242809==_.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Kazaa Sues Movie, Recording Industries
http://story.news.yahoo.com/news?tmpl=story2&u=/ap/20030128/ap_on_hi_te/internet_music_trial 



Sharman Networks Ltd. filed its counterclaim Monday in response to a 
copyright-infringement lawsuit brought by several recording labels and 
movie studios. That lawsuit accuses Sharman of providing free access to 
copyright music and films to millions of Internet users in the United States.

The latest filing came two weeks after U.S. District Judge Stephen V. 
Wilson dismissed Sharman's claim that it could not be sued in the United 
States because it is based in Australia and incorporated in the South 
Pacific nation of Vanuatu.

Wilson had found Sharman subject to U.S. copyright laws because it has 
substantial usage by Californians and its actions are alleged to contribute 
to commercial piracy within the United States.

Sharman's counterclaim alleges copyright misuse, monopolization, and 
deceptive acts and practices.

"In seeking to simultaneously stop illegal copying and to maintain their 
dominant position in the distribution of musical and movie content, the 
industry plaintiffs have obscenely overreached," Sharman said.

It seeks a jury trial, damages, attorney fees and a permanent injunction 
against the entertainment industry so that it can't "enforce any of their 
United States copyrights against any person or entity."

Sharman said the entertainment companies are behind the times and don't 
realize that consumers need not buy CDs, DVDs or videotapes to enjoy music 
or films.

Sharman also claimed that movie studios "dominate and, when they act in 
concert, have monopoly power" for the aftermarket distribution of first-run 
major motion pictures. Likewise, the company said, recording labels "when 
they act in concert, have monopoly power in the distribution of recorded 
music."

Movie studios involved in the lawsuit include Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Studios 
Inc., Columbia Pictures Industries Inc., Disney Enterprises Inc., Paramount 
Pictures Corp. The recording labels are BMG, EMI, Sony, Universal and Warner.

In a statement, the Recording Industry Association of America (news - web 
sites) called Sharman's arguments "laughable."

"Sharman's claims are akin to the thief who plunders Fort Knox and then 
claims she's not responsible because Fort Knox declined to buy her 
second-rate security system," the RIAA said.

The case is one of the largest in the recent online copyright wars testing 
the international reach of U.S. courts.

___

On the Net:

Kazaa: http://www.kazaa.com

Movie industry: http://www.mpaa.org


Moksha Tribe

there. I dont know what I'm going to wear yet, but I have blond hair which is 
shaved on the back and sides, more than likely it will be in pigtails.
Britty

Message-ID: <20030129180627.41558.qmail@web10208.mail.yahoo.com>
Date: Wed, 29 Jan 2003 10:06:27 -0800 (PST)
From: Angelica Kuhl <akuhlangel@yahoo.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="0-1252886046-1043863587=:40492"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Urgent, SFLNC needs your support

--0-1252886046-1043863587=:40492
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

SFLNC Members,

Please excuse the late notice of this request and read on to find out 
why your action is needed TODAY!

The San Francisco Late Night Coalition needs people to attend a hearing
tomorrow, Wednesday - January 29th at 6 PM in room 416 of City Hall. 
The hearing is at the Board of Permit Appeals and is a request by the 
Lingba Lounge to receive a Place of Entertainment Permit (POE) and overturn 
the Police Department's denial of their request.

To read more go to: http://www.lingba.com/Lingba_Home.htm

The SFLNC became involved in this issue when the owner of the lounge, 
Cody Robertson, contacted us to find out if it was true that he needed to 
have a permit for his friends to play music in his 49 person cocktail 
lounge. It turns out that the previous owners had a juke box which Cody 
replaced with turntables and he did not realize at the time that making that 
change triggered the requirement to have a POE, just like 1015 Folsom or Ruby
Skye.

His neighbors (the Potrero Boosters) got involved in opposing his application and in that neighborhood, that spelled disaster.  Cody changed his sound system and passed a sound inspection by the SFPD but that was not enough.  It seems forgiveness is not big on the "Hill" and nothing Cody could do would stop the system from denying him his permit. He even operated in the same manner as a couple of SOMA bars that don't have a POE, but to no avail.  He was cited on Saturday and his turntables seized by the SFPD.

To read about this go to: http://www.sfbg.com/37/18/news_lingba.html

And that takes us to the hearing.  When you are denied a permit, you have
the right to appeal that decision to the Board of Permit Appeals and that
is what he is doing.  Until the police seized his turntables this last Saturday, he planned for the hearing to be low key.  But the Potrero Boosters have been urging residents who oppose the Lingba Lounge to fill the hearing room and so we must do the same.

Show your support of San Francisco Culture; tell the government to 
support the entertainment community by showing up at the hearing.

You will not be required to speak; your presence in the audience will 
be enough.

I hope to see you there!

Respectfully,

Terrance Alan
Chairperson
San Francisco Late Night Coalition





the rumor is love,
the word is peace,

start a rumor!
spread the word!!

Do you Yahoo!?
Yahoo! Mail Plus - Powerful. Affordable. Sign up now
--0-1252886046-1043863587=:40492--

X-OriginalArrivalTime: 29 Jan 2003 19:05:15.0047 (UTC) FILETIME=[5B185370:01C2C7C9]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] I'm back

That's right all, I'm back...
    Just thought that I'd say hi and let you all know that I am back in the 
city.  I was arrested last Sunday night on some bogus charges by the SFPD 
(which were dropped by the DA, probably because of a lack of evidence).  
They roughed me up pretty good and stripped me naked and paraded me around 
the jail.  They didn't give me any clothes until 9:30 the next morning 
because I was "a threat to myself and others," although I was detained in a 
"Safety Cell" by myself for a majority of the evening.  I'm doing better now 
though.  This is my first day of attending class because of all of the BS 
that I have had to deal with the last few days.  Most of my bruises are 
going away and doing better now.  Anybody down to do some booty shakin' this 
weekend?  I need to do a little promoting for a party, but most of all I 
need to get my groove on.  Anybody who wants to chill, hit me back.
Lots of love,
Trendy, aka Malacai

Subject: Re: [sfraves] I'm back

We were walking home from the bar at about 12:30 and we were picked up for 
public intoxication.  I thought it was BS and I didn't refrain from sharing 
my opinion.  They (the people with the cuffs) didn't like my verbal 
rebellion.  I used a lot of demeaning language and I got hog-tied and beaten 
in response.  To be honest, I didn't have the most cooperative attitude and 
I asked a lot of questions.  I don't think it really takes much to piss off 
the SFPD though.  Especially after the brutal superbowl loss; the boys in 
blue were itchin' for some redemption.  It wasn't a barrel full of monkeys, 
but I learned an important lesson.  Cops are just frat-boys who weren't 
smart enough to get into college.
-Trendy.

Hello,

If you're looking to book someone to play at your party, club, or event,
you should consider my live PA Cybrid.
Please take a moment to visit our website, and check out some info, mp3s,
and pictures of us at past gigs.

We're also available individually for dj sets. Jim (Skoop) plays
new-school electro, IDM, and glitchy techno. As Audioel, I play funky
electro, breaks, tech-house, deep house, and minimal techno.

If you don't know who we are, we're local SF-based musicians who've been
part of the club scene for many years. My previous live PA - Protolab -
played at many parties and events from '94 to 2001. :)

Write back if you're interested.

Some believe the "go" date for the invasion is February 5th.  If that is 
so, a number of people will hit the streets in protest.

The next large march and rally for San Francisco is scheduled for February 
16th, Sunday, not the 15th.  The change was made to accommodate the Chinese 
New Year's Celebration.

As many of you know, we have organized a group called Ravers for Peace from 
interested parties on this list.  Ravers for Peace will participate in the 
February 16th event.

Love,

Apollo

"Anti-war organizers agreed to push next month's peace march and rally in Sa=
n=20
Francisco back a day, to Feb. 16, in order to avoid a conflict with the=20
long-planned Chinese New Year's Parade.=A0 ... ending a potential public=20
relations and logistical nightmare that drew in the mayor and other elected=20
officials. ...=20
Two major events on the same day would put a pinch on everything from traffi=
c=20
control and police enforcement to portable potties, officials said.=A0 ....
... even though dozens of anti-war demonstrations are scheduled to take plac=
e=20
around the world on Feb. 15, local organizers didn't want to bump up against=
=20
one of the most popular cultural events in San Francisco and a big draw for=20
Chinatown. ... Police officials at first thought that the two events could=20
co-exist, mainly because they estimated that the anti-war march would draw=20
only 10,000 to 20,000. But when organizers said 10 times that many may show=20
up, the thinking changed."
 =20
This is a triumph, that everybody recognizes there will be HUGE numbers, mor=
e=20
than SF can handle the same day as the Chinese NY parade.=20

before then, we'll have to blow up -- er, i mean CROSS -- that bridge when w=
e=20
get to it!

A lot of you may not have even heard of this drug, but it used to be legal
to purchase...


http://www.cognitiveliberty.org/dll/amt_5-MeO-DIPT_%20alert.html

DEA Moves to Schedule Two More "Hallucinogens"

Yesterday (28 Jan. 2003) the Drug Enforcement Administration moved to
place two more "hallucinogens" into Schedule I of the federal Controlled
Substances Act.

The two substances are Alpha-methyltryptamine (AMT) and
5-methoxy-N,N-diisopropyltryptamine (5-MeO-DIPT).
(Click either link to learn more.)


The Center for Cognitive Liberty & Ethics (CCLE) is reviewing the notice,
and will evaluate what action to take in response.

Donate to Support Cognitive Liberty
Donations are tax-deductible.

At 04:56 PM 1/29/2003 -0800, Omid Tavallai wrote:
>on 1/29/03 4:08 PM, Apollo at apollo@speakeasy.org wrote:
>
> > At 03:39 PM 1/29/2003 -0800, J.C. wrote:
> >> And if we go to war before the 15th:
> >> http://sfbayguardian.com/37/18/x_oped.html
> >
> > Some believe the "go" date for the invasion is February 5th.  If that is
> > so, a number of people will hit the streets in protest.
>
>Actually, I'm pretty sure Feb 05 is the date that the US is supposed to
>present evidence of Iraq's weapons of mass destruction to the UN, in order
>to garner support for an invasion in late Feb or mid-March.  Then again,
>that's what the corporate news whores have reported in the last couple of
>days, so I could be totally misled :)
>
>  - omid

Lots of speculation here.  Some think Bush may go on the 5th after the 
presentation.   Strategically, February is supposed to be good weather for 
war in Iraq.  Then, there is pressure to end the uncertainty about war that 
is affecting the stock markets -- ASAP.

Most people, however, think this invasion is inevitable whether there is 
support in the UN or not. Of course we will win initially:  at the cost of 
hundreds of thousands of civilian lives destroyed by either military action 
or post-invasion collapse of infrastructure.

Immoral,  preemptive warfare (only "defensive" war is considered just in 
Western convention) is only the beginning of the horrors to come.

Everyone wants a piece of Iraq.  Iran, for example, will not officially 
stand in the way of regime change there but, as one senior official said 
recently:  "If the Americans stay more than a few weeks, then we will 
declare a holy war on them."  Victory will not be sweetness and light 
here.  We are marching into quicksand...

Love,

Apollo



Moksha Tribe

becomes transformed."
-Heinrich Zimmer

there it sits nevertheless, calmly licking its chops."
-H. L. Mencken

Int'l Act Now to Stop War and End Racism (A.N.S.W.E.R.) Coalition

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROTEST AND WALKOUTS

The day a new US war on Iraq starts - emergency protest at Powell and 
Market St at 5 p.m., the next day at 5 p.m. if the war begins at night, 
followed by a march through city neighborhoods.

THE MORNING AFTER THE WAR STARTS -- WALK OUT/STAYAWAY! ORGANIZE WALK OUTS 
from school, work, etc. Spend the morning leafleting for people to join the 
anti-war movement. Converge mid-day at noon at Civic Center Plaza to 
protest the war. The ANSWER Coalition is preparing a flyer that will be on 
the web site calling for people to walk out on the day after an attack.

We urge activists in other cities and towns to organize similar activities.

THE FOLLOWING SATURDAY, mass protest rally and marches. Leaflets and local 
times and locations of demonstrations will be available on 
www.internationalanswer.org

In San Francisco, the 5 PM day-of emergency response protest gathers at 
Powell at Market St. 12 noon convergence the day after the war starts 
gathers at City Hall at Grove and Polk St. The Saturday after mass protest 
gathers at UN Plaza at 7th and Market Streets.

For updates and questions - call the ANSWER-SF office at 415-821-6545 or 
check the website at www.InternationalANSWER.org.
__________________________________________

International A.N.S.W.E.R. (Act Now to Stop War & End Racism)
2489 Mission St., Rm. 24, San Francisco, CA 94110 * Phone: 415-821-6545 * 
Fax: 415-821-5782 Email: answer@actionsf.org * Web:
www.internationalanswer.org

a picture in sfgate.com's "picture of the day":

http://www.sfgate.com/news/pictures/2003/01/29/managua7.jpg

"Dear world, stomach rumbling, send meat: Tina the Bengal tiger enjoys a
head rub from National Nicaraguan Zoo veterinarian Eduardo Sacasa in
Managua.
The zoo's 454 animals are down to their last six days of food following
the government's decision to cut off zoo funding. The zoo was told to seek
handouts from other zoos around the world."

lets step back from this whole iraq thing and think out our furry pals, whom
are being held captive against their will, and thanks to bureaucratic
nonsense, will soon be out of food.

i'd be willing to go without a meal for a day to feed some starving
animals...

New RAVE ACT 

The RAVE Act is back!! 

Its now called the Illicit Drug Anti-Proliferation
Act. 

DONT BE FOOLED! Its the RAVE Act in new clothing.
Last year you helped stop the RAVE Act from becoming
law. We need your help again. Fax Senators and tell
them that this bill hurts innocent business owners,
undermines public safety, and stifles free speech and
musical expression. 

http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/action/index.asp?step=2&item=1448

nic

i was trying to determine the authenticity of this cover (which is track #5
on groove armada's "another late night") when i came across this:
http://covers.wiw.org/

The Covers Project - http://covers.wiw.org/
"Welcome to The Covers Project. We're building a database of cover songs
(songs performed by an artist other than the original performer) with the
intention of creating cover "chains." A cover chain is a set of songs in
which each song is a cover of a song by the band who covered the preceding
song."

and our song in particular:

http://covers.wiw.org/artist.php/15259

enjoy,

MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] why more people don't question things nrr

more people are aware than you think, babydoll.

if someone questioned me over dinner, as you
suggested, with the assumption that i had not thought
of the same question myself, "why are you working with
a bunch of moral and emotional sell-outs?", i might
perhaps say something like, "because i'm biding my
time and paying my fucking bills till something better
comes along."  

truth be told, i consider myself lucky at the moment
to be working and associating with people that i don't
see as being sell-outs.  and truth be told, we're all
sell-outs anyway, in the great big ol' grand scheme of
things.

questions like that don't fly well over dinner because
they ignore one too-oft overlooked aspect of reality -
and that is, we've all got our reasons and just
because *you* don't know what they are, doesn't mean
that no one else does.  to me, that is a beautiful
example of the kind of ignorance that works most
effectively as an obstacle to "making" magic happen in
relationships.

have a great thursday y'all.

;)sooz

<http://www.allergyalternative.com/~mindstudio>

Subject: [sfraves] Action Alert! Biden Introduces New RAVE Act!!!

It only takes a few seconds to fax your senator! please do it! Let 
them know we won't stand for the destruction of our freedoms! This 
kind of misguided legislation is just one example of how the so 
called "War on Drugs" has turned our country into a virtual police 
state.


 From The Drug Policy Alliance:
------------------------------------------
*** Biden Introduces New RAVE Act!!!
*** Your Help Urgently Needed

Several weeks ago we warned you that last year's RAVE Act was
incorporated into Sen. Daschle's domestic security bill (S. 22). It
gets worse. Senators Biden (D-DE), Grassley (R-IA), Feinstein (D-CA),
and Lieberman (D-CT) have introduced it as a stand-alone bill (S.
226 - which is not posted on thomas.loc.gov yet. We'll link from our
site,  http://www.drugpolicy.org , once it becomes available). It's
not called the RAVE Act. Nor does it have a findings section talking
about raves or electronic music. It's now called the Illicit Drug
Anti-Proliferation Act. DON'T BE FOOLED! It's the RAVE Act in new
clothing. If enacted, it would harm innocent business owners,
undermine public safety, and stifle free speech and musical
expression.

Your help is needed to stop this disguised RAVE Act from becoming
law!!!

*** Fax your two Senators. Tell them to oppose S. 226 the Illicit
     Drug Anti-Proliferation Act. You can use our convenient system:
     http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/action/

     Or find your Senators's fax number at:
     http://www.senate.gov

*** Please forward this action alert to your friends and family. The
     Senate needs to know that voters find this bill unacceptable.

For more information on the RAVE Act and S. 226 see:
http://www.nomoredrugwar.org/music/rave_act.htm

Please consider making a donation to help the Drug Policy Alliance
continue to fight for our rights: http://www.drugpolicy.org/join

We need your support to stop this bill!
---------------------------------------------------

Once again, we all have to get together and make our voice heard!


Regards,

Andy Somers



-- 
Drug Laws Are Worse Than Drugs Themselves

http://www.DrugActionNetwork.com

http://www.just-say-know.com

Subject: [CS] Biden Introduces New RAVE Act  !!!!!!!!!!1

www.tronicatickets.com


*** Biden Introduces New RAVE Act!!!
*** Your Help Urgently Needed

Several weeks ago we warned you that last year's RAVE Act was
incorporated into Sen. Daschle's domestic security bill (S. 22). It
gets worse. Senators Biden (D-DE), Grassley (R-IA), Feinstein (D-CA),
and Lieberman (D-CT) have introduced it as a stand-alone bill (S.
226 - which is not posted on thomas.loc.gov yet. We'll link from our
site,  http://www.drugpolicy.org , once it becomes available). It's
not called the RAVE Act. Nor does it have a findings section talking
about raves or electronic music. It's now called the Illicit Drug
Anti-Proliferation Act. DON'T BE FOOLED! It's the RAVE Act in new
clothing. If enacted, it would harm innocent business owners,
undermine public safety, and stifle free speech and musical
expression.

Your help is needed to stop this disguised RAVE Act from becoming
law!!!

*** Fax your two Senators. Tell them to oppose S. 226 the Illicit
     Drug Anti-Proliferation Act. You can use our convenient system:
     http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/action/

     Or find your Senators's fax number at:
     http://www.senate.gov

*** Please forward this action alert to your friends and family. The
     Senate needs to know that voters find this bill unacceptable.

For more information on the RAVE Act and S. 226 see:
http://www.nomoredrugwar.org/music/rave_act.htm

Please consider making a donation to help the Drug Policy Alliance
continue to fight for our rights: http://www.drugpolicy.org/join

We need your support to stop this bill!





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

Apollo


Failing Anti-terror Campaign: Afghani Drug Flow Unchanged

Thur, Jan 30, 2003


According to Russia's Border Guard Service, the US-led anti-terror 
operation in Afghanistan has done nothing to reduce the flow of illegal 
drugs. Russia is a major transit point for Afghan opium and heroin making 
its way to the lucrative markets of Western Europe. Russian officials have 
repeatedly complained about the continuing trade.

Russia has apparently provided the U.S. and its allies with data on drug 
storage and production sites in Afghanistan without result. Russia's 10,700 
border guards stationed in the former Soviet republic of Tajikistan, 
bordering Afghanistan, had prevented about 90 drug smuggling attempts, 
detained 65 illegal border crossers, and seized more than 4 tons of illegal 
drugs last year, however these have minor impact on the massive market.

Interdiction efforts by the US and Russia will remain futile without 
appropriate development resources for opium farmers in the devastated 
country of Afghanistan. The current war against drugs continues to increase 
the cost of drugs, making drug trafficking more profitable and therefore 
more attractive - particularly to those living in poverty.

http://www.drugpolicy.org/news/01_30_03failing.cfm

Importance: Normal
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] SRR: The Digital Music Education Foundation

The Digital Music Education Foundation (DMEF) is a not for profit
corporation founded in 2002 with the goal of using music production,
playback, and manipulation technologies to teach math and science to
elementary and secondary school students particularly in economically
challenged and diverse urban school districts.  Currently we are in the
process of developing our first programs and curricula for the 2003-2004
school year and we plan to have at least one after school or in school
program operating in San Francisco this fall.  We hope to expand from there
to additional schools and other cities.

While we are in the process of raising funding from the usual corporate
donors, we are seeking additional help from the rave and electronic music
communities directly to make this project a reality.  Naturally cash
donations are accepted, but we are also looking for donations of music
equipment of all sorts, office space (we are willing to share a space), and
more.

We are currently looking for volunteers to help us create our website,
produce marketing materials, to help with the development of our math and
science curricula, to teach courses, etc.  If you think you might be able to
help out please drop us a note describing your skills, experience, and
expertise as well as how you think you could help.  Sorry these are all
unpaid volunteer only positions at this time.

We also are in the early stages of planning a benefit event for the spring
or summer, and and would like to hear from promoters, DJs, and venue owners
that might be able to help us make this event a success.

The DMEF is a 501c(3) non-profit corporation and all donations are tax
deductible.

If you have anything to offer, including just a few words of support, please
e-mail me directly off the list at rothmans@gte.net.

Warm regards,

Peter Rothman
President & Founder, DMEF

From sfraves-return-98324-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Thu Jan 30 23:48:59 2003

Received: (qmail 66486 invoked from network); 30 Jan 2003 23:48:58 -0000
Message-ID: <20030130234906.22339.qmail@web10207.mail.yahoo.com>
Date: Thu, 30 Jan 2003 15:49:06 -0800 (PST)
From: Angelica Kuhl <akuhlangel@yahoo.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="0-360643774-1043970546=:20819"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Lingba Lounge Update...

--0-360643774-1043970546=:20819
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii


Last night the Board of Permit Appeals met to hear Lingba Lounges request that the Police Departments denial of Lingbas Place of Entertainment (POE) permit application be overturned.  (The police denied his permit and he wanted that decision overturned).

 The room was packed to overflowing.  The item was put at the end of the calendar and was finally heard at 7 PM.

 The Police, represented by Sgt Bill Coggin, presented their case for denial based on the failure of the Planning Department to decide if the POE use was permitted at Lingbas property.  

 The Planning Department, represented by Larry Badner, presented their case that Planning was notified of the requested POE, sent out a public notice and received a request for a Discretionary Review (DR) of the application.  That DR request meant that the case had to go before the Planning Commission, but there was no Planning Commission (remember).  So before that review was scheduled the Police decided that since they had not heard from the Planning Department, it must mean they said no and advised Planning that they had denied the permit.  And so, of course, Planning cancelled the DR process.  

 Yes folks, it was a classic Catch-22 situation.  

 Attorney for Lingba, Mark Rennie, argued the case that Lingba had a constitutional right to the POE.  The Lingba was zoned for entertainment and that since the majority of opposition was about sound complaints and Lingba had passed its sound test, they deserved the permit.  Mark went on to point out that San Francisco had better wake up to the diminishing hotel tax revenue resulting from a loss of tourism and invest in its entertainment community to get the tourists back in town.  I personally loved his line that San Francisco seems to eat its young when describing the obvious generation gap between those opposed to Lingba and those in favor of it.

 So what was decided after hearing all the testimony of the neighbors about how horrible Lingba Lounge was to the neighborhood and after hearing from the Lingba folks how great it was to have the Lingba in the neighborhood, that the case would be held at the call of the chair so that the Planning Department could hold its DR process.

 Comments from the Commissioners gave a glimpse as to how they felt on the merits of the case and how they might rule if the application comes before them again, which they expect it to.  Their comments were generally that Lingba had better get together with the neighbors and work out a mitigating plan and the neighbors had better agree to meet in earnest to develop that plan.  The lack of trust in each other was noted by most of the Commissioners.  I think that the key to this success is for the Lingba bend over backwards and try to find common ground with the neighbors.  Document the effort and be prepared to defend their process.

 So now Lingba must do a DR in front of the Planning Commission and the Commission  will decide if his proposed POE use is allowed and tell the Police Department, if a POE is allowed and with what, if any conditions.

 Then the police will hold a hearing and decide if Lingba gets its permit.  And if they deny it we are back to the Board of Permit Appeals to have them hear the case.

 My take on this is that the case has gotten everyones attention and that done carefully; Lingba will get its POE.  The POE may have restrictions and some of those may be onerous, but after a successful year of operation, Lingba can petition the Entertainment Commission to review and change the restrictions.

 So there we are.  Light years ahead of what would have happened two years ago when the Lingba would have been trounced.

 The advocacy of the SFLNC and the willingness of our volunteers and members to participate in the process of changing our city is paying off.  



I want to thank and acknowledge fellow Steering Committee Members, Angelica, Barbara and Kim for attending tonights hearing and thank the general membership for their continued support of San Franciscos Late Night Culture.

 Respectfully,

Terrance Alan
Chairperson

spread the word!!

	boundary="=====================_35462636==_.ALT"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] National Review Article on current Anti-Rave Legislation

--=====================_35462636==_.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

This is the side of true conservatives I used to admire.


January 30, 2002 10:35 a.m.
Feel Like Dancing?
Beware of Tom Daschle.

By Dave Kopel & Glenn Reynolds



When John Ashcroft was nominated for attorney general, his political=20
enemies spent a lot of time mocking him for belonging to a denomination=20
that does not allow its members to engage in dancing. Since taking office,=
=20
Mr. Ashcroft has done absolutely nothing to infringe upon the rights of=20
people who like to dance. Tom Daschle, however, is now pushing legislation=
=20
that could send dance promoters to federal prison for up to 20 years.=20
Daschle's anti-dancing legislation is a mean-spirited assault on youth=20
culture, and an extreme violation of principles of federalism.

Last year, there was a big push in Congress to enact the so-called "RAVE=20
Act," sponsored by Rep. Lamar Smith (D., Tex.) as H.R. 5519 and in the=20
Senate by Joseph Biden (D., Del.). Both lead sponsors were very forthright;=
=20
the very title of the bill announced its intention to go after "raves" =97=
=20
dance parties popular with Generations X and Y.

But the "RAVE Act" aroused enormous opposition, so much so that the Senate=
=20
Judiciary chairman withdrew his co-sponsorship of the bill.

This year, the same act is back; but this time it's concealed deep within=20
an immense, omnibus bill sponsored by Tom Daschle =97 the so-called "Justice=
=20
Enhancement and Domestic Security Act of 2003" (S. 22). That Act includes=20
some antiterrorist measures which are important and which ought to be=20
debated in separate bills (for instance, authorizing military tribunals for=
=20
al Qaeda warriors).

But S. 22 is also larded with numerous anti-civil-liberties proposals,=20
including ballistics testing for all new firearms, and anti-gun-show=20
language making gun shows presumptively illegal except when authorized by=20
the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms. Daschle's S. 22 is the=20
contemporary version of the 1994 Clinton crime bill, a bloviated monster=20
that was far too large for either Congress or citizens to be able to=20
understand its contents.

And the "RAVE Act" reappears too =97 only this time, the word "RAVE" never=
=20
appears in a title. Rather, the "RAVE Act" language is found in sections=20
5131-36, under the misleading title "Crack House Statute Amendments."

The Daschle bill extends the federal "crackhouse law" =97 which makes it=20
illegal to maintain a building for purposes of drug consumption =97 to cover=
=20
musical performances and other events of a temporary nature, and to make=20
liable even those who make their premises available at no charge. The idea=
=20
is to make the promoters of musical events liable for drug consumption at=20
those events =97 even when the consumption is entirely incidental, and has=
=20
nothing to do with any action by the promoters. The legislation is, in=20
effect, an admission of failure by the Drug Enforcement Agency: Unable to=20
control drug use, it's looking to force concert promoters and theaters to=20
do it, on pain of imprisonment.

As amended by Daschle, the "crackhouse law" would make it a 20-year federal=
=20
felony to "manage or control any place, whether permanently or temporarily,=
=20
either as an owner, lessee, agent, employee, occupant, or mortgagee, and=20
knowingly and intentionally rent, lease, profit from, or make available for=
=20
use, with or without compensation, the place for the purpose of unlawfully=
=20
manufacturing, storing, distributing, or using a controlled substance."

This language is broad enough to encompass not only rave promoters and disc=
=20
jockeys, but also bar owners, hotel or motel owners, concert promoters,=20
tour bus or cruise ship operators =97 and even home owners. Literally read,=
=20
the statute would even apply to a homeowner whose teenagers occasionally=20
smoked marijuana on the property.

The existing track record of the "crackhouse law" offers no reason to be=20
confident that overzealous prosecutors will not push the law to the extreme=
=20
limits of its language. As we detailed in a previous column, the then-U.S.=
=20
attorney of New Orleans brought felony "crackhouse" charges against the=20
owners of the historic State Palace Theater. Jordan argued that the sale on=
=20
the premises of "drug paraphernalia," such as glowsticks and even bottled=20
water, was somehow evidence that the owners were colluding in drug=20
consumption at dance parties.

But in truth, those who use drugs, or sell drugs, at raves and concerts are=
=20
responsible for their own actions, and it makes no more sense to blame the=
=20
concert promoter, or the owner of the hall, for their activities than it=20
does to blame the owner of a hotel in whose convention center illegal=20
campaign donations are made for campaign fraud. Nor does it make sense to=20
blame cruise-ship operators or homeowners.

The word "rave" appears nowhere in the criminal language, but shows up only=
=20
in section 5136 (still under the "crackhouse" title), which authorizes the=
=20
Drug Enforcement Administration to be appropriated more tax dollars "to=20
educate youth, parents, and other interested adults about the drugs=20
associated with raves."

Most of the Daschle bill =97 including his misnamed "crackhouse" amendments,=
=20
as well as the current crackhouse law =97 is a gross abrogation of=20
federalism. If people operate facilities that lure drug users in=20
disproportionate numbers, the traditional remedy is a public nuisance=20
action, brought by the local district attorney in state court.

The crackhouse law and the Daschle extension replace that remedy =97 which=
=20
has been considered adequate for well over a century =97 with an extremely=
=20
harsh federal criminal statute. This isn't because local authorities have=20
been complaining that the problem has interstate dimensions that elude=20
them. Indeed, drug use =97 at a concert, or in a bar, or in a home =97 is by=
=20
its nature a very local activity. This isn't a statute about interstate=20
drug sales, but about local drug use or possession.

Frustrated by the failure to reduce Ecstasy use, federal bureaucrats and=20
their congressional allies are now looking to attack easy-to-find public=20
targets. Some have even admitted that their real target isn't drugs per se,=
=20
but rather the "rave culture" =97 even though some earlier efforts at=20
prosecuting rave promoters have been enjoined
http://www.emdef.org/cases/nola_StatePalace/nola_plea_injunction.pdf
on First Amendment grounds.

This legislation is the latest stage of mission creep for federal law=20
enforcement, aided and abetted by members of Congress who should know=20
better. As the Musician's Guide to Drug Policy Reform observes,=20
empire-building federal bureaucrats have been whipping up culture-war=20
hysteria against musicians ever since Henry Alsinger blamed "swing" music=20
(and its practitioners, such as Glenn Miller) for marijuana use.

Under a federal system, it is supposed to be state and local governments,=20
and not the federal government, that deal with matters of local law=20
enforcement. There's nothing in the Constitution authorizing the federal=20
government to waste taxpayer money "educating" the public about the dangers=
=20
of swing music, rave music, or any other form of music.

We are continually reminded, as a justification for restrictions on civil=20
liberties, that we are at war. But, precisely because we are at war, we=20
cannot afford to have the Justice Department and federal law-enforcement=20
authorities wasting their time on the kind of trivia represented by much of=
=20
S. 22, including the misnamed "crackhouse" provision. The Constitution=20
gives Congress and the federal government the duty to provide for the=20
national defense; to allow them to exercise never-granted powers over local=
=20
crimes and music styles is to undermine that essential focus on national=20
defense.

=97 Dave Kopel is an NRO contributing editor and research director at the=20
Independence Institute. Glenn Reynolds, otherwise known as Instapundit, is=
=20
a law professor at the University of Tennessee.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR:  Failing Anti-terror Campaign: Afghani Drug Flow Unchanged

Last I checked we didn't go into Afghanistan in order to curtail their drug
trade, we went in to find Bin Laden and to remove the Taliban from power.
This is a damned if we do damned if we don't situation.  If the article
reported that we had begun a massive campaign to eliminate the drug trade in
Afghanistan, you'd be writing that good ol' W was using the war on terrorism
as an excuse to further the drug war.  Further I'd probably be reading posts
about how we had mistakenly burned down the fields of poor Afghani farmers
because we mistakenly believed them to be drug traffikers.

The headline would be "US. Forces burn wrong fields, accidentally kill 5
innocents"

Followed by ten posts about how we had no business burning the fields in the
first place, and how our soldiers should be looking for Bin Laden and not
wasting time on our immoral and irresponsible drug war.

Not to mention what is wrong with Russia that they can't just do this
themself?  I don't think we or anyone else are gonna complain if they decide
to bring in a few troops to wipe out some poppy fields and production sites.

At what point does self loathing become unhealthy?

Just Curious,
Mark
PTA

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR:  Failing Anti-terror Campaign: Afghani Drug Flow Unchanged

> the Taliban was one of the only outfits that helped eliminate opium
> production.
>
> when they held sway in Afghanistan, they pretty much eliminated *all*
poppy
> growth


Really?  Well I admit I'd heard that before somewhere, but then it seems
like we have a bit of a contradiction.

The original article that started this thread said this.

"border guards stationed in the former Soviet republic of Tajikistan,
bordering Afghanistan, had prevented about 90 drug smuggling attempts,
detained 65 illegal border crossers, and seized more than 4 tons of illegal
drugs last year, however these have minor impact on the massive market."

Massive Market?

Hmm, well if they did all that last year, then the "massive market" it only
had a "minor impact on" must also have existed last year.

If the Massive Market existed last year, then it sure must have existed
before we ever removed the Taliban from power, cause massive markets don't
just spring up in a few months, and neither do poppy fields.

Not to mention the article didn't exactly make it sound as if the issue of
drug trafficking out of Afghanistan was a new one for Russia.

"According to Russia's Border Guard Service, the US-led anti-terror
operation in Afghanistan has done nothing to reduce the flow of illegal
drugs."

It sounds to me like there must have already been a flow of drugs before we
got there, else what would there have been for us to reduce?

*baffled look*
Mark

----> The Tentacle List <-----------------------------------------------


Call for Large Sculpture

We are looking for LARGE pieces of sculpture to place in front of a club
named 1015 Folsom on Feb. 13th, 2003. This is a Thursday.

The address of the club is the same as the name.

The event is Ascension and it includes performance, video art, fine art, 
and
music.

Outside the club, visuals will be projected onto the side of the building
and we'd like to have large pieces of sculpture on display too. It's not
very often that you can display your sculpture all night on a sidewalk in
San Francisco.

You would need to deliver it on the 13th and remove it after the event at 3
a.m. or at 2 a.m. would be okay too.

During the event, a security guard will be outside, but after the event, it
will be your responsibility to move it and protect it.

Please email me: kcascension@yahoo.com

Love and light,
KC

Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="=====================_10640521==_.ALT"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  Chinese Horoscope For the New Year

--=====================_10640521==_.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Tomorrow is the Chinese New Year.  The Year of the Ram in a Flock of Ewes.

The notion of a ram in the middle of a flock of ewes, (male in the middle 
of many females) may appear to some to be a position of good fortune. 
However, much as this may have some benefit, it also means that this year 
is a year in which it is easy to be seen, and therefore behaviour must be 
appropriate if you are not to be noticed for the wrong reasons. It will 
certainly be a year when inappropriate behaviour will be far more 
noticeable, and open to challenge.

The Ram is the most mild mannered of all of the Chinese zodiac animals, and 
can be prone to a little nervousness. The ram is an animal that avoids 
confrontation whenever possible, and a quiet life is always preferred to 
any other kind.

The direction with which the Ram is associated is not north, south, east or 
west, but the Chinese fifth direction, (not used in the West) - central. 
This centrality is perhaps indicative of the Ram's desire for peace and 
tranquillity, and the avoidance of taking sides. Though not taking sides 
may be advantageous at times, it may also be perceived as a lack of support 
for the position held by others, and as such may make for criticism or 
unsettling times.

This trait may be exacerbated by the Ram's paradoxically sharp tongue. 
Rarely used in malice, it is often a result of thoughtlessness. It is wise, 
therefore, in this year to think carefully about what one says, but 
equally, to try to see beyond the words people actually use, and to 
understand the motivation behind what is said. Without taking that extra 
care, confusion may arise, and this may lead to conflict.

ON THE FIRST day of Lunar New Year, after 1.30am to be exact, find a yellow
bag, walk north-west and buy something - anything - to put in it. Once the
mission has been accomplished, head home and go to bed, placing the
knotted bag on your pillow above your head. This will bring good luck in the
Year of the Goat, advises Chinese astrologer Edwin Ma Lai-wah.

With good luck assured, try not to overindulge or splash out unnecessarily.

What your sign says:
RAT (born in 1936, 1948, 1960, 1972, 1984, 1996): Watch out for
obstacles in your love life. A third party may creep in if you neglect your
loved one. Although money won't be a problem, try not to over-indulge.

OX (1937, 1949, 1961, 1973, 1985, 1997): Don't just work all the time -
lift your head and look at the world outside. Accept and welcome any changes,
but most importantly, have fun. Creative activities such as karaoke, acting
and ballroom dancing would help to soothe your worried mind.

TIGER (1938, 1950, 1962, 1974, 1986, 1998): A great year for love:
marriageis on the cards for singles and children for couples. When not
working, try some adventurous activities and competitive sports to fulfill
your need to be challenged. Be careful with money.

RABBIT (1939, 1951, 1963, 1975, 1987, 1999): Expect a tumultuous love
life- try to enjoy the lows as well as the highs. Speak up and be frank with
your partner. To relax, stick with quieter forms of entertainment, such as
going to the movies and reading books, to prevent any further aggravation to
your already troubled mind.

DRAGON (1940, 1952, 1964, 1976, 1988, 2000): Try not to think too much
and stop banging your head against a brick wall. This is a wonderful year
for love - don't run away from it. Go to lots of parties, meet new people
and travel. It's a year for fun, so don't just sit at home.

SNAKE (1941, 1953, 1965, 1977, 1989, 2001): Although patience is a
virtue, wait no longer - this year is a good one for setting plans in action.
You will do well financially and share the fruits of your hard work with a
loved one - so be romantic and happy together.

HORSE (1930, 1942, 1954, 1966, 1978, 1990, 2002): Even though you may
not feel like going out, try to get away once in a while. Go for a hike, get
some fresh air. Expect a year of obstacles and opposition. Know thy
enemy a useful activity would be people-watching in shopping centres and
cafes.

GOAT (1931, 1943, 1955, 1967, 1979, 1991, 2003): Your partner will be in
the mood to go out, splash out and have fun. Join in. Don't expect too much
to happen this year. Just go with the flow, and don't put too much pressure
on yourself to do well.

MONKEY (1932, 1944, 1956, 1968, 1980, 1992): With the help of a lucky
star illuminating your path, you should do well financially. Although you may
yearn to be alone, try to be sociable. Expect arguments in
relationships, though they should not be too damaging.

ROOSTER (1933, 1945, 1957, 1969, 1981, 1993): There will be endless
social obligations - try to avoid unnecessary ones. Stay clear of places of
sexual temptation, such as girlie bars and hostess clubs. If you invest wisely
and patiently and are not over-confident, this should be a prosperous year.

DOG (1934, 1946, 1958, 1970, 1982, 1994): This is a good year for going
to art galleries and theatres, but stay clear of noisy functions and
unnecessary challenges. In relationships, an old partner may leave and a
new one could appear. Try not to swim against the tide and accept that this
is not your year. Wear something light yellow to ward off bad luck.

PIG (1935, 1947, 1959, 1971, 1983, 1995): Leave plenty of room for
manoeuvre in every aspect of your life. You are bound to overspend so try to
cut back: don't always eat out, and rent movies instead of going to the
cinema. You will be the source of arguments in relationships, so try to
control your temper.

Moksha Tribe

----> The Tentacle List <-----------------------------------------------


Call for Large Sculpture

We are looking for LARGE pieces of sculpture to place in front of a club
named 1015 Folsom on Feb. 13th, 2003. This is a Thursday.

The address of the club is the same as the name.

The event is Ascension and it includes performance, video art, fine art,
and
music.

Outside the club, visuals will be projected onto the side of the building
and we'd like to have large pieces of sculpture on display too. It's not
very often that you can display your sculpture all night on a sidewalk in
San Francisco.

You would need to deliver it on the 13th and remove it after the event at 3
a.m. or at 2 a.m. would be okay too.

During the event, a security guard will be outside, but after the event, it
will be your responsibility to move it and protect it.

Please email me: kcascension@yahoo.com

Love and light,
KC
www.artsf.org

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  Medical Marijuana Week Events in San Francisco

--=====================_12369911==_.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Medical Marijuana Week Events in San Francisco

Saturday, Feb. 15th
+ 12 Noon - 215 Press Conference in front of Golden Gate Park Conservatory.
We will announce that we are planting 215,000 marijuana seeds in SF.
Volunteers needed to show up in gardening costumes with shovels and 
gardening tools.
+ 3:00 pm, Ceremony + erecting Marijuana Leaf Banner at the top of Twin Peaks.
+ 7:00 pm, Compassion and Care Center at 122 10th St. will host a kick-off
party for Medical Marijuana Week. Mayoral Candidate Tom Ammiano will speak
and Rand Crook and Chad Man will give a short film presentation.

Sunday, Feb. 16th
+ 11:00am till 5:00pm, we will be tabling at the Peace Rally in the Civic
Center Park. We need volunteers for tabling, leafletting and street theatre.

Monday, Feb. 17th
+ 350 Divisadero Club will be open for sign and banner making.  Time TBA 415-
820-1517.

Tuesday, Feb. 18th
Noon - EVICT THE DEA!! We will rally in front of 450 Golden Gate the Federal
Building, at noon. We need volunteers who are interested in dressing in
costume. People considering committing civil disobedience that day should
attend a training Feb. 9, call ASA at 510-486-8083 to reserve a spot.

Wednesday, Feb. 19th
Dance Safe at SFSU and ASA SF will sponsor a Shattered Lives exhibit at
the SF State University. We will table during the day and hold a forum
inviting marijuana activist to speak.

Thursday, Feb. 20th
Noon - Diane Feinstein dress up day. The Diane's will meet at Market &
Montgomery St. in front of the Senator's office. Volunteer to be a Diane and
join us.  Wear a red business dress or SF ASA will supply the costume.

Friday, Feb. 21st.
  From 4:20 till dark, activists will meet on Van Ness Ave. We will position
ourselves along Van Ness and hold Burmashave signs that spell out a strong
our message. Meet on City Hall steps, Van Ness side at 4:00 pm.

Saturday, Feb. 22nd-
+ All day - Love Shack hosting a day of workshops and talks. Call
415-552-5121 for schedule.
+ 2:00 pm, The Honorary Dennis Peron Medical Marijuana March thru the Castro.
We will have a Marijuana and Dennis Peron costume contest and march thru the
Castro.
+ 8:00 pm -  350 Divisadero Club will host a closing celebration party that
evening.


There are no observers, only participants! Put on your costumes, bring your
outrage & outrageousness, and join in! To find out how to get more involved,
call 415-820-1517.





Moksha Tribe

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

Subject: [sfraves] intro- DJ Baby Daddy, SF's original Ghettotech pimp

yo!

I've been kicking it here in SF for years now,
mixing records at house parties, clubs, 
even a couple times at Burningman 
and anyway- its long overdue that 
I chimed in on this list.

My style is to take dope shit from all 
different genres and see how fresh
I can combine them in the mix. 
A good example is ghettotech.  

For those who might not be familiar, 
its a style where the DJ will throw in 
booty tracks with jungle, electro, hip hop, 
sped up house or techno - whatever.

if you're still like, "whuhhh?"
just hit this link--> http://ghettoblasta.net

ALSO-
come check out my weekly- "Ghett Set" 
every friday night from 7-10 at Skylark,
on 16th and Valencia in the Mission, SF.  

At this gig, I focus on hip hop - new and old 
- radio and underground - but I mash it up wid
idm, jungle, funky house, hard house, electro, 
breakbeats, techno, disco and ol skool funk.

alrighty...nice to tap into the forum.
if you dig on ghettotech, or if you just a freak,
or just any one whose seen me around, plz drop a line-
babydaddy@ghettoblasta.net

peace!
Rob

Once again Friday night is looking a little weaksauce so some wonderful
friends are continuing the SFR houseparty circuit this week in SF. Once
again it's open decks and featuring a large powered Mackie setup. This is a
rare opportunity to play beneath the streets of SF and I encourage everyone
to come out for this. DJ's bring your records. Grab a friend and make them
go. They aren't stopping until the sun comes up. Oh wait - the sun never
shines there... That means this party will be going for a loooong time.

grin on your face. Steal people from lame clubs before you come over and
show them what a real party is like!

From: "innocentchild" <innocentchild@hotmail.com>

Subject: [sfraves] BSP :: SFR.house.party.goes.underground // literally :: FREE :: ALL NIGHT // ALL
AGES :: SF


Once again Friday night is looking a little weaksauce so some wonderful friends are continuing the
SFR houseparty circuit this week in SF. Once again it's open decks and featuring a large powered
Mackie setup. This is a rare opportunity to play beneath the streets of SF and I encourage everyone
to come out for this. DJ's bring your records. Grab a friend and make them go. They aren't stopping
until the sun comes up. Oh wait - the sun never shines there... That means this party will be going
for a loooong time. Bring whatever your drink of choice may be or whatever else puts a sloppy grin
on your face. Steal people from lame clubs before you come over and show them what a real party is
like!

the coming year.

considered to be a vicious canard, that the women here, as a whole are
absolutely stunning, is no canard, but the God's Honest Truth, my heart goes
pitter-pat at least a bunch of times a day, and that's just on my in in the

----- Original Message -----
From: "Apollo" <apollo@speakeasy.org>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Friday, January 31, 2003 3:17 PM
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Chinese Horoscope For the New Year


Tomorrow is the Chinese New Year.  The Year of the Ram in a Flock of Ewes.

The notion of a ram in the middle of a flock of ewes, (male in the middle
of many females) may appear to some to be a position of good fortune.
However, much as this may have some benefit, it also means that this year
is a year in which it is easy to be seen, and therefore behaviour must be
appropriate if you are not to be noticed for the wrong reasons. It will
certainly be a year when inappropriate behaviour will be far more
noticeable, and open to challenge.

The Ram is the most mild mannered of all of the Chinese zodiac animals, and
can be prone to a little nervousness. The ram is an animal that avoids
confrontation whenever possible, and a quiet life is always preferred to
any other kind.

The direction with which the Ram is associated is not north, south, east or
west, but the Chinese fifth direction, (not used in the West) - central.
This centrality is perhaps indicative of the Ram's desire for peace and
tranquillity, and the avoidance of taking sides. Though not taking sides
may be advantageous at times, it may also be perceived as a lack of support
for the position held by others, and as such may make for criticism or
unsettling times.

This trait may be exacerbated by the Ram's paradoxically sharp tongue.
Rarely used in malice, it is often a result of thoughtlessness. It is wise,
therefore, in this year to think carefully about what one says, but
equally, to try to see beyond the words people actually use, and to
understand the motivation behind what is said. Without taking that extra
care, confusion may arise, and this may lead to conflict.

ON THE FIRST day of Lunar New Year, after 1.30am to be exact, find a yellow
bag, walk north-west and buy something - anything - to put in it. Once the
mission has been accomplished, head home and go to bed, placing the
knotted bag on your pillow above your head. This will bring good luck in the
Year of the Goat, advises Chinese astrologer Edwin Ma Lai-wah.

With good luck assured, try not to overindulge or splash out unnecessarily.

What your sign says:
RAT (born in 1936, 1948, 1960, 1972, 1984, 1996): Watch out for
obstacles in your love life. A third party may creep in if you neglect your
loved one. Although money won't be a problem, try not to over-indulge.

OX (1937, 1949, 1961, 1973, 1985, 1997): Don't just work all the time -
lift your head and look at the world outside. Accept and welcome any
changes,
but most importantly, have fun. Creative activities such as karaoke, acting
and ballroom dancing would help to soothe your worried mind.

TIGER (1938, 1950, 1962, 1974, 1986, 1998): A great year for love:
marriageis on the cards for singles and children for couples. When not
working, try some adventurous activities and competitive sports to fulfill
your need to be challenged. Be careful with money.

RABBIT (1939, 1951, 1963, 1975, 1987, 1999): Expect a tumultuous love
life- try to enjoy the lows as well as the highs. Speak up and be frank with
your partner. To relax, stick with quieter forms of entertainment, such as
going to the movies and reading books, to prevent any further aggravation to
your already troubled mind.

DRAGON (1940, 1952, 1964, 1976, 1988, 2000): Try not to think too much
and stop banging your head against a brick wall. This is a wonderful year
for love - don't run away from it. Go to lots of parties, meet new people
and travel. It's a year for fun, so don't just sit at home.

SNAKE (1941, 1953, 1965, 1977, 1989, 2001): Although patience is a
virtue, wait no longer - this year is a good one for setting plans in
action.
You will do well financially and share the fruits of your hard work with a
loved one - so be romantic and happy together.

HORSE (1930, 1942, 1954, 1966, 1978, 1990, 2002): Even though you may
not feel like going out, try to get away once in a while. Go for a hike, get
some fresh air. Expect a year of obstacles and opposition. Know thy
enemy a useful activity would be people-watching in shopping centres and
cafes.

GOAT (1931, 1943, 1955, 1967, 1979, 1991, 2003): Your partner will be in
the mood to go out, splash out and have fun. Join in. Don't expect too much
to happen this year. Just go with the flow, and don't put too much pressure
on yourself to do well.

MONKEY (1932, 1944, 1956, 1968, 1980, 1992): With the help of a lucky
star illuminating your path, you should do well financially. Although you
may
yearn to be alone, try to be sociable. Expect arguments in
relationships, though they should not be too damaging.

ROOSTER (1933, 1945, 1957, 1969, 1981, 1993): There will be endless
social obligations - try to avoid unnecessary ones. Stay clear of places of
sexual temptation, such as girlie bars and hostess clubs. If you invest
wisely
and patiently and are not over-confident, this should be a prosperous year.

DOG (1934, 1946, 1958, 1970, 1982, 1994): This is a good year for going
to art galleries and theatres, but stay clear of noisy functions and
unnecessary challenges. In relationships, an old partner may leave and a
new one could appear. Try not to swim against the tide and accept that this
is not your year. Wear something light yellow to ward off bad luck.

PIG (1935, 1947, 1959, 1971, 1983, 1995): Leave plenty of room for
manoeuvre in every aspect of your life. You are bound to overspend so try to
cut back: don't always eat out, and rent movies instead of going to the
cinema. You will be the source of arguments in relationships, so try to
control your temper.

Moksha Tribe

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness.  It is
not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a purpose."
-Helen Keller

"Knowledge is the reward of action... For it is by doing things that one
becomes transformed."
-Heinrich Zimmer

"Penetrating so many secrets, we cease to believe in the unknowable.  But
there it sits nevertheless, calmly licking its chops."
-H. L. Mencken

----- Original Message -----
From: "Apollo" <apollo@speakeasy.org>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Friday, January 31, 2003 3:46 PM
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Medical Marijuana Week Events in San Francisco


Medical Marijuana Week Events in San Francisco

Saturday, Feb. 15th
+ 12 Noon - 215 Press Conference in front of Golden Gate Park Conservatory.
We will announce that we are planting 215,000 marijuana seeds in SF.
Volunteers needed to show up in gardening costumes with shovels and
gardening tools.
+ 3:00 pm, Ceremony + erecting Marijuana Leaf Banner at the top of Twin
Peaks.
+ 7:00 pm, Compassion and Care Center at 122 10th St. will host a kick-off
party for Medical Marijuana Week. Mayoral Candidate Tom Ammiano will speak
and Rand Crook and Chad Man will give a short film presentation.

Sunday, Feb. 16th
+ 11:00am till 5:00pm, we will be tabling at the Peace Rally in the Civic
Center Park. We need volunteers for tabling, leafletting and street theatre.

Monday, Feb. 17th
+ 350 Divisadero Club will be open for sign and banner making.  Time TBA
415-
820-1517.

Tuesday, Feb. 18th
Noon - EVICT THE DEA!! We will rally in front of 450 Golden Gate the Federal
Building, at noon. We need volunteers who are interested in dressing in
costume. People considering committing civil disobedience that day should
attend a training Feb. 9, call ASA at 510-486-8083 to reserve a spot.

Wednesday, Feb. 19th
Dance Safe at SFSU and ASA SF will sponsor a Shattered Lives exhibit at
the SF State University. We will table during the day and hold a forum
inviting marijuana activist to speak.

Thursday, Feb. 20th
Noon - Diane Feinstein dress up day. The Diane's will meet at Market &
Montgomery St. in front of the Senator's office. Volunteer to be a Diane and
join us.  Wear a red business dress or SF ASA will supply the costume.

Friday, Feb. 21st.
  From 4:20 till dark, activists will meet on Van Ness Ave. We will position
ourselves along Van Ness and hold Burmashave signs that spell out a strong
our message. Meet on City Hall steps, Van Ness side at 4:00 pm.

Saturday, Feb. 22nd-
+ All day - Love Shack hosting a day of workshops and talks. Call
415-552-5121 for schedule.
+ 2:00 pm, The Honorary Dennis Peron Medical Marijuana March thru the
Castro.
We will have a Marijuana and Dennis Peron costume contest and march thru the
Castro.
+ 8:00 pm -  350 Divisadero Club will host a closing celebration party that
evening.


There are no observers, only participants! Put on your costumes, bring your
outrage & outrageousness, and join in! To find out how to get more involved,
call 415-820-1517.





Moksha Tribe

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness.  It is
not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a purpose."
-Helen Keller

becomes transformed."
-Heinrich Zimmer

"Penetrating so many secrets, we cease to believe in the unknowable.  But
there it sits nevertheless, calmly licking its chops."
-H. L. Mencken
